page.title: 12River Alne at Little Alne
page.content: I measured the depth of the River Alne in July 1985,at the bottom of the field of Holyoake house.The average depth at the edge was 26cm,in the middle 19cm.We had floods in the autumn and March.When it floods and dies down there are hardly any shrimps at the edge of the river.This is because the fast flowing current carries them away.On the river or in it are lots of creatures,so I did a bit of surveying on the river.I found-House Martins,Female Mallards, Male Shrimps,Trout and a Moorhen.In the summer it is very good for trout fishing.
